description: Replace 2^k with (-2)^k in binary expansion of n.
comments: Base 2 representation for n (in lexicographic order) converted from base -2 to base 10.Maps natural numbers uniquely onto integers; within each group of positive values, maximum is in A002450; a(n)=n iff n can be written only with 1's and 0's in base 4 (A000695)a(n) = A004514(n) - n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 27 2003
links: R. Stephan, Table of generating functions
example: a(9)=-7 because 9 is written 1001 base 2 and (-2)^3+(-2)^0=-8+1=-7
mathematica: f[n_Integer, b_Integer] := Block[{l = IntegerDigits[n]}, Sum[l[[ -i]]*(-b)^(i - 1), {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; a = Table[ FromDigits[ IntegerDigits[n, 2]], {n, 0, 80}]; b = {}; Do[b = Append[b, f[a[[n]], 2]], {n, 1, 80}]; b
